sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Joe Biden and Vladimir Putin talk over the phone as tensions over a possible invasion of Ukraine continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Police in Paris are trying to stop hundreds of vehicles blocking the streets as a so-called freedom convoy descends on the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Police in London have sent the UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson a questionnaire as part of their investigations into allegations of illegal lockdown parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After the result of a failed drug test came to light this week, 15-year-old Russian skating star Kamila Valieva will know on Monday whether she is able to continue the Olympics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: High-stake talks over Ukraine are taking place between Russian President Vladimir Putin and

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: his U.S. counterpart Joe Biden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Tensions are high as the U.S. says a Russian invasion of Ukraine could be imminent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But before the two heads of state started the path of diplomacy, Putin talked once again to French President Emmanuel Macron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It came just a week after the two met in person to try to resolve the crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The U.S. has also announced plans to evacuate its embassy in the Ukrainian capital amid fears of the possible invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It also asked all its citizens to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Germany, Spain, Italy and Belgium are among some of the states following suit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But in Ukraine, citizens remained resilient on Saturday, with thousands protesting on the streets of Kiev to show unity amid fears of a possible invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Many carried banners that read, Ukrainians will resist and no to Putin, whilst also chanting glory to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has encouraged people not to panic and pushed back against what he calls bleak war predictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However he did attend police drills in the southern Kherson region, 30 kilometers from Russian-occupied Crimea, on Saturday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And he said a Russian attack could happen at any time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He also told journalists that Ukraine was ready to counter any action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile joint Russian-Belorussian military exercises continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to Belorussian military, they are expected to go on until February 20.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia has continually denied accusations that its thousands of soldiers on Ukraine's border are gathered there to invade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Police around Paris have struggled to prevent hundreds of vehicles reaching the city centre as part of a protest against France's COVID-19 regulations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The rally was inspired by the so-called Freedom Convoy in Canada that descended on Ottawa and occupied the city's streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: French authorities said over 7,000 officers have been deployed in an attempt to stop the same happening in Paris, where the protest was banned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Cars and vehicles from across the country started to descend on the city around 10 o'clock on Saturday morning, many having holed up overnight on the outskirts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Authorities have towed some vehicles away and impounded them, and there were reports of over 100 arrests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Anti-Covid protesters were joined by France's Yellow Jackets in wider discontent with the administration of President Emmanuel Macron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In the Netherlands, a similarly inspired protest took place in The Hague, where truckers and sympathisers blocked access to Parliament buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Ontario Superior Court ordered protesters at the Ambassador Bridge over the US-Canadian border to end the blockade that started on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The injunction came into effect at 7pm local time on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After speaking to Joe Biden, Justin Trudeau, criticised by his opposition parties for his lack of action, issued a stern warning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I want to make something very clear. The illegal blockades seeking to take our neighbourhoods and our economy hostage and the collective Covid fatigue we are facing are two very separate things. If you joined the protests because you're tired of COVID, you now need to understand that you are breaking laws. The consequences are becoming more and more severe. It is not clear if law enforcement officers will be sent in to remove the truckers that protest against COVID-19 restrictions. The demonstrations have disrupted the flow of goods between the US and Canada and forced the auto industry on both sides to roll back production. On Friday, the premier of Ontario, the province where the Ambassador Bridge is located, and the federal capital of Ottawa, also declared a state of emergency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The UK Prime Minister is still under pressure to resign over allegations of illegal parties in Downing Street during Covid lockdowns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He's one of around 50 people who've been sent a questionnaire by police in London investigating the accusations over the so-called Partygate affair.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So far, Johnson has insisted he won't step down, and his party's MPs have not launched any official challenge to his leadership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But a recent poll found that 63% of those surveyed think he should resign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Even before the party gates he wasn't a reliable person and I think we should get rid of him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I just think it was completely disrespectful and a disregard to all the guidelines that he's put in and everything like that just wasn't fair yeah on the people and i think if it was treason may it should be out of power yeah straight away so he's getting a lot of leeway for it he's gotten away with a lot yeah for sure i don't think he should be saying no he's good in one way and then he's done wrong in the other way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But I think government's all the same anyway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Many of Boris Johnson's party MPs are waiting to see the results not just of the criminal investigation but also the full version of an internal report by Sue Gray, a senior civil servant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Partygate comes at a critical time for Johnson, who's one of many European leaders trying to find a diplomatic resolution to the Ukraine crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Myanmar's military junta has released what appears to be hundreds of prisoners to mark the 75th anniversary of Union Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It announced an amnesty for over 800 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, it is unclear whether some of the country's thousands of political prisoners are among those being freed. Crowds gathered outside one prison in Yangon to see if they could find their loved ones. Myanmar has been in political turmoil since February 2021, when the military seized control after a general election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Security is deteriorating rapidly across the country as fighting and armed conflict intensifies with no sign of abating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: UNHCR forecasts an accelerating trend in displacements in the coming weeks and months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The military junta's pardon and release of prisoners is common for public holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But this year it also called for unity in the country, on an iconic national holiday that symbolises that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Iran, firefighters said they managed to put out a fire at Tehran's Grand Bazaar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The city's fire department said the blaze broke out in the shoemaker's section on Saturday morning and ended up damaging up to 25 shops. The spokesman for the department said there were no fatalities but two people had been injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Police in Spain have arrested one of Europe's most wanted criminals. The Slovenian, whose full name hasn't yet been confirmed, was wanted over accusations of involvement in a heroin smuggling network that brought over 300 kilograms of the drug to Slovenia from Iran, according to the Spanish newspaper El Mundo. He was detained at a luxury residential compound in Barcelona. The Court of Arbitration for Sports should decide on Monday whether 15-year-old figure skater Kamila Valieva is allowed to carry on and compete in the individual events of the Winter Olympics on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Russian prodigy's emerging career has been into jeopardy over a doping scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The journalists who first reported on this story on Wednesday have spoken out of being subjected to threats, abuse or warnings to check their tea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Understandably, all sorts of arguments on all sides and it's not acceptable for that to turn into threats and violence if indeed it did.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think we all need to take a chill pill, I think people would say when I was younger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This week, Kamila Valieva helped Russia win gold in the team event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She even became the first female skater to land a quadruple jump at an Olympics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But on Tuesday, a test taken last December flagged for traces of a banned substance, trimethyzedine, a drug which is used in the prevention of chest pain, but could also improve physical efficiency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After two years of break because of covet 19 the nice carnival has resumed for two weeks around

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 85 000 people are expected on the french riviera following unlimited 2020 edition and a blank year in 2021 the event which is celebrating its 149th anniversary, found a delighted audience at its opening ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's a party here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The people of Nice, the people of the French Riviera and all the tourists have been patiently waiting for this for two years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's a real reunion carnival.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's such a pleasure, the joy of living.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We forget about COVID, we forget about everything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We're here and we're enjoying it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We love our life and it's awesome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We forget about everything. We are here and we are enjoying it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We love our life and it's awesome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This carnival, whose first edition took place back in 1873, is one of the most important in the world, along with the ones in Rio de Janeiro and Venice.
